intro: Rinorea gazensis, commonly known as the Gambia rinorea, is a flowering plant native to western Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
